turns.content: Hello, am I speaking with Kumar Singh? This is Priya calling from QuickLend Financial Services regarding your personal loan account.
Yes, this is Kumar Singh. I've been expecting your call, to be honest. My loan payments are overdue, and I want to explain the situation - I recently lost my job due to the factory closure.

Kumar, I'm so sorry to hear that. Losing a job can be really tough. Can you tell me a bit more about your current financial situation, and we can discuss possible options for getting your loan payments back on track?

I'm struggling to make ends meet, Priya, and I have a family of four to support. I'm actively looking for a new job, but it's taking some time. I was thinking, if possible, could I get an extension on my payments until I find a new job and get back on my feet?

I understand your situation, Kumar, and I'm willing to work with you. An extension is possible, but I'd like to explore a more structured approach. How about we consider restructuring your EMIs to a lower amount for the next few months, and then we can reassess once you're back to work? Would that be something you'd be interested in?

That sounds like a good option, Priya. A lower EMI would really help me right now. Can I send you some documents to prove I've lost my job, like a closure notice from the factory or something, to support my case for the restructuring?

That would be helpful, Kumar. Please do send us the closure notice and any other relevant documents, such as a copy of your job termination letter. I'll review them and see what we can do to assist you. In the meantime, I can offer you a temporary reduction of, say, 50% of your current EMI for the next three months - would that be acceptable to you?

That's a big relief, Priya. 50% reduction for three months would be a huge help. Yes, that's acceptable to me. I'll send the documents to you right away. Can I get that in writing, though, just to confirm the new payment amount and the temporary arrangement?

I'll send you a formal email with the revised payment details and the temporary restructuring agreement, Kumar. You'll receive it within the next 24 hours, and it will outline the new EMI amount and the three-month period. I'll also follow up with a call next week to ensure you've received the email and to discuss the next steps. Sound good?
That sounds great, Priya. Thank you so much for your help and understanding. I really appreciate it. Yes, that sounds like a plan, and I'll look out for the email. [AGREES TO PLAN]
